file.content:
version: 2

builds:
  - main: ./cmd/entire
    binary: entire
    env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=0
    goos:
      - darwin
      - linux
    goarch:
      - amd64
      - arm64
    ldflags:
      - -s -w
      - -X entire.io/cli/cmd/entire/cli.Version={{.Version}}
      - -X entire.io/cli/cmd/entire/cli.Commit={{.ShortCommit}}

notarize:
  macos:
    - enabled: '{{ isEnvSet "MACOS_SIGN_P12" }}'
      sign:
        certificate: "{{.Env.MACOS_SIGN_P12}}"
        password: "{{.Env.MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD}}"
      notarize:
        issuer_id: "{{.Env.MACOS_NOTARY_ISSUER_ID}}"
        key_id: "{{.Env.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID}}"
        key: "{{.Env.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY}}"
        wait: true
        timeout: 45m
        retry: 1

archives:
  - formats:
      - tar.gz
    name_template: "{{ .ProjectName }}_{{ .Os }}_{{ .Arch }}"

checksum:
  name_template: "checksums.txt"

changelog:
  sort: asc
  filters:
    exclude:
      - "^docs:"
      - "^test:"
      - "^chore:"

content.thinking:
Ah I see - line 31 has `retry: 1` which isn't a valid field for the MacOSNotarize configuration in GoReleaser v2.13.2. This is a configuration that was added in a recent PR (from the git log I saw earlier about "increase timeout, add a single retry"), but GoReleaser doesn't support this field.

I should check the GoReleaser documentation to see what fields are actually supported for notarization. But since the error is clear - `retry` is not a valid field - I should just remove it.

Let me check the GoReleaser docs to confirm the available options for notarization.

content.text:
The issue is that `retry: 1` on line 31 isn't a valid field for GoReleaser's notarize config. GoReleaser v2.13.2 doesn't support a `retry` field in the MacOSNotarize configuration.

Let me check the current GoReleaser documentation for valid notarize fields:

content.content:
Web search results for query: "goreleaser notarize macos configuration options 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Notarize macOS applications - GoReleaser","url":"https://goreleaser.com/customization/notarize/"},{"title":"Notarizing Golang Applications with GoReleaser","url":"https://jaredallard.dev/notarizating-golang-applications-with-goreleaser/"},{"title":"GitHub - goreleaser/example-notarized-apps: Example of GitHub workflow building and notarizing a macOS App","url":"https://github.com/goreleaser/example-notarized-apps"},{"title":"Complete Gon/goreleaser workflow for signing and notarizing · goreleaser · Discussion #3350","url":"https://github.com/orgs/goreleaser/discussions/3350"},{"title":"integrate mitchellh/gon lib for signing and notarizing macOS binaries · Issue #1227 · goreleaser/goreleaser","url":"https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/1227"},{"title":"Announcing GoReleaser v2.8 | Carlos Becker","url":"https://carlosbecker.com/posts/goreleaser-v2.8"},{"title":"GitHub - joemiller/goreleaser-gon-poc: experiment using goreleaser with gon for codesigning and notarizing macOS Go apps","url":"https://github.com/joemiller/goreleaser-gon-poc"},{"title":"GoReleaser - Archives, installers, packages, and checksums","url":"https://goreleaser.com/customization/sign/"},{"title":"Homebrew Casks - GoReleaser","url":"https://goreleaser.com/customization/homebrew_casks/"},{"title":"GoReleaser - Announcing GoReleaser v2.8","url":"https://goreleaser.com/blog/goreleaser-v2.8/"}]

Based on the search results, here's the information about GoReleaser macOS notarization configuration options:

## GoReleaser macOS Notarization

With the release of GoReleaser v2, there's finally official support for notarizing macOS binaries.(no content)GoReleaser Pro and OSS can already sign and notarize binaries, but DMGs and .apps are a whole different ordeal. Version 2.8 adds support for this.

### Two Methods Available

**1. Standard Binary Notarization (`notarize.macos`):**

Do not use this method if you create App Bundles. App Bundles in which only the binary is signed/notarized are deemed damaged by macOS. In that case, use the native signing and notarizing.

Configuration options include:
- `enabled` - Whether this configuration is enabled (default: false, templates allowed)
- `ids` - IDs to filter built binaries (default: project name)
- `sign.certificate` - The .p12 certificate file path or its base64 contents, and `sign.password` - The password for the certificate

**2. Native Notarization (`notarize.macos_native`) - for DMGs/App Bundles:**

This feature is available since v2.8 and is exclusively available with GoReleaser Pro.(no content)This method can sign and notarize App Bundles, but it depends on xcrun and codesign. For now, it'll only work if you package your app as a DMG.

Configuration options:
- `enabled` - Whether enabled (default: false, templates allowed)
- `ids` - IDs to filter built binaries (default: project name)
- `sign.keychain` - Path to the Keychain, and `sign.identity` - The identity in Keychain
- `sign.options` - Options to pass to 'codesign' (you generally want to add 'runtime' here)
- `sign.entitlements` - Path to signature entitlements XML file
- `notarize.profile_name` - Profile name for notarization (templates allowed)

### Required Environment Variables (for CI/GitHub Actions)

For native notarization, you'll need: `MACOS_SIGN_P12` (base64 of .p12 key), `MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD`, `KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD`, `MACOS_NOTARY_PROFILE_NAME`, `MACOS_NOTARY_KEY` (base64 of .p8 key), and `MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID`.

### Performance Note

Note that notarization will take awhile the first time (it took 2 hours), but subsequent uploads should be under 15 minutes.

For more details, see the official documentation at https://goreleaser.com/customization/notarize/ and the example repository at https://github.com/goreleaser/example-notarized-apps which demonstrates how to create, sign, and notarize a macOS App and DMG with GoReleaser.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.title: GitHub - goreleaser/example-notarized-apps: Example of GitHub workflow building and notarizing a macOS App
Complete Gon/goreleaser workflow for signing and notarizing · goreleaser · Discussion #3350
integrate mitchellh/gon lib for signing and notarizing macOS binaries · Issue #1227 · goreleaser/goreleaser
GitHub - joemiller/goreleaser-gon-poc: experiment using goreleaser with gon for codesigning and notarizing macOS Go apps
GoReleaser - Archives, installers, packages, and checksums

Based on the search results, here's the information about GoReleaser macOS notarization configuration options:

## GoReleaser macOS Notarization

With the release of GoReleaser v2, there's finally official support for notarizing macOS binaries.(no content)GoReleaser Pro and OSS can already sign and notarize binaries, but DMGs and .apps are a whole different ordeal. Version 2.8 adds support for this.

### Two Methods Available

**1. Standard Binary Notarization (`notarize.macos`):**

Do not use this method if you create App Bundles. App Bundles in which only the binary is signed/notarized are deemed damaged by macOS. In that case, use the native signing and notarizing.

Configuration options include:
- `enabled` - Whether this configuration is enabled (default: false, templates allowed)
- `ids` - IDs to filter built binaries (default: project name)
- `sign.certificate` - The .p12 certificate file path or its base64 contents, and `sign.password` - The password for the certificate

**2. Native Notarization (`notarize.macos_native`) - for DMGs/App Bundles:**

This feature is available since v2.8 and is exclusively available with GoReleaser Pro.(no content)This method can sign and notarize App Bundles, but it depends on xcrun and codesign. For now, it'll only work if you package your app as a DMG.

Configuration options:
- `enabled` - Whether enabled (default: false, templates allowed)
- `ids` - IDs to filter built binaries (default: project name)
- `sign.keychain` - Path to the Keychain, and `sign.identity` - The identity in Keychain
- `sign.options` - Options to pass to 'codesign' (you generally want to add 'runtime' here)
- `sign.entitlements` - Path to signature entitlements XML file
- `notarize.profile_name` - Profile name for notarization (templates allowed)

### Required Environment Variables (for CI/GitHub Actions)

For native notarization, you'll need: `MACOS_SIGN_P12` (base64 of .p12 key), `MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD`, `KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD`, `MACOS_NOTARY_PROFILE_NAME`, `MACOS_NOTARY_KEY` (base64 of .p8 key), and `MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID`.

### Performance Note

Note that notarization will take awhile the first time (it took 2 hours), but subsequent uploads should be under 15 minutes.

For more details, see the official documentation at https://goreleaser.com/customization/notarize/ and the example repository at https://github.com/goreleaser/example-notarized-apps which demonstrates how to create, sign, and notarize a macOS App and DMG with GoReleaser.

content.thinking: Let me check the official GoReleaser documentation page to see the exact fields supported for the notarize config.

input.prompt: What are all the valid configuration fields for the notarize.macos configuration, specifically for the notarize sub-section? Is there a retry field?

content.content:
Based on the provided documentation, the valid configuration fields for `notarize.macos.notarize` are:

1. **issuer_id** - "The issuer ID. Its the UUID you see when creating the App Store Connect key."

2. **key_id** - "Key ID. You can see it in the list of App Store Connect Keys."

3. **key** - "The .p8 key file path or its base64'd contents."

4. **wait** - "Whether to wait for the notarization to finish."

5. **timeout** - "Timeout for the notarization" (default: 10m)

**No retry field is documented** in the configuration excerpt provided. The documentation only mentions these five fields for the notarize subsection under `notarize.macos`.

3. **key** - "The .p8 key file path or its base64'd contents."

4. **wait** - "Whether to wait for the notarization to finish."

5. **timeout** - "Timeout for the notarization" (default: 10m)

**No retry field is documented** in the configuration excerpt provided. The documentation only mentions these five fields for the notarize subsection under `notarize.macos`.

content.thinking:
Confirmed - there's no `retry` field in the GoReleaser notarize configuration. The available fields are:
- issuer_id
- key_id
- key
- wait
- timeout

The `retry: 1` field needs to be removed. Based on the git history, it looks like this was recently added (commit 4a98f72 "increase timeout, add a single retry") but GoReleaser doesn't support this field.

I should remove the `retry: 1` line to fix the configuration error.

content.text:
Confirmed - GoReleaser doesn't support a `retry` field in the notarize configuration. The valid fields are only: `issuer_id`, `key_id`, `key`, `wait`, and `timeout`.

The `retry: 1` line needs to be removed:

version: 2

builds:
  - main: ./cmd/entire
    binary: entire
    env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=0
    goos:
      - darwin
      - linux
    goarch:

      - -X entire.io/cli/cmd/entire/cli.Commit={{.ShortCommit}}

notarize:
  macos:
    - enabled: '{{ isEnvSet "MACOS_SIGN_P12" }}'
      sign:
        certificate: "{{.Env.MACOS_SIGN_P12}}"
        password: "{{.Env.MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD}}"
      notarize:
        issuer_id: "{{.Env.MACOS_NOTARY_ISSUER_ID}}"
        key_id: "{{.Env.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID}}"
        key: "{{.Env.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY}}"
        wait: true
        timeout: 45m
        retry: 1

archives:
  - formats:

checksum:
  name_template: "checksums.txt"

changelog:
  sort: asc
  filters:
    exclude:
      - "^docs:"
      - "^test:"
      - "^chore:"

content.thinking: Done. I've removed the `retry: 1` line since GoReleaser doesn't support that field in the notarize configuration. The timeout of 45m is still there which should help with any timeout issues during notarization.

content.text:
Fixed. Removed the `retry: 1` line since GoReleaser doesn't support that field.

If you need retry behavior for notarization failures, you'll need to handle it at the CI/workflow level (e.g., using GitHub Actions retry mechanisms) rather than in the GoReleaser config.

Sources:
- [GoReleaser Notarize Documentation](https://goreleaser.com/customization/notarize/)

file.content:
name: Release

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - "v*"

permissions:
  contents: write

jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v6
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v6
        with:
          go-version-file: go.mod

      - name: Run GoReleaser
        uses: goreleaser/goreleaser-action@v6
        with:
          distribution: goreleaser-pro
          version: latest
          args: release --clean
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          GORELEASER_KEY: ${{ secrets.GORELEASER_KEY }}
          MACOS_SIGN_P12: ${{ secrets.MACOS_SIGN_P12 }}
          MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD }}
          MACOS_NOTARY_ISSUER_ID: ${{ secrets.MACOS_NOTARY_ISSUER_ID }}
          MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID: ${{ secrets.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID }}
          MACOS_NOTARY_KEY: ${{ secrets.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY }}

content.thinking:
Now I need to add retry logic to the GoReleaser step. GitHub Actions doesn't have native retry support, but there are a few approaches:

1. Use a community action like `nick-fields/retry` 
2. Use a shell script with a loop

The `nick-fields/retry` action is well-maintained and commonly used. Let me add that to wrap the GoReleaser step.

content.text: I'll add retry logic using the `nick-fields/retry` action, which is the standard approach for GitHub Actions:

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: Release

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - "v*"

permissions:
  contents: write

jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v6
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v6
        with:
          go-version-file: go.mod

      - name: Run GoReleaser
        uses: goreleaser/goreleaser-action@v6
        with:
          distribution: goreleaser-pro
          version: latest
          args: release --clean
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          GORELEASER_KEY: ${{ secrets.GORELEASER_KEY }}
          MACOS_SIGN_P12: ${{ secrets.MACOS_SIGN_P12 }}
          MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.MACOS_SIGN_PASSWORD }}
          MACOS_NOTARY_ISSUER_ID: ${{ secrets.MACOS_NOTARY_ISSUER_ID }}
          MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID: ${{ secrets.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY_ID }}
          MACOS_NOTARY_KEY: ${{ secrets.MACOS_NOTARY_KEY }}

content.thinking:
Good, I've added the retry logic using `nick-fields/retry@v3`. I had to switch from using the `goreleaser/goreleaser-action` to using the curl command approach because the retry action needs a command to run, not a nested action.

The configuration:
- `timeout_minutes: 60` - 60 minute timeout per attempt (generous for notarization)
- `max_attempts: 2` - Will retry once if the first attempt fails

This should handle transient notarization failures.

content.text:
Done. The release workflow now uses `nick-fields/retry@v3` with:
- **max_attempts: 2** - will retry once on failure
- **timeout_minutes: 60** - 60 minute timeout per attempt

I switched to using GoReleaser's official install script since the retry action wraps a command rather than another action. This is the recommended approach from GoReleaser's docs.
